intro: Cacalia mollis, commonly known as the softstem bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family, which includes many bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in open woodlands and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. Its flowers are blue to violet in color, with five petals arranged in a bell shape, and it blooms from late spring to early summer. Cacalia mollis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in gardens with full sun to partial shade.
